Detailed Description

This class handles user rights as applied to maps.

Each right will map to a single bit in the mapset, which means that logical 'and' and 'or' can be used to handle these rights.

Some useful combination of rights.

ALL_TRAFFIC  Combines all traffic information rights.
TRAFFIC_AND_SPEEDCAM 

Definition at line 60 of file MapRights.h.

enum MapRights::Rights
 

List of available rights.

The enum value indicates which bit is used for that right. The binary value of a right is calculated with (1 << RIGHT).

Enumeration values:
BASIC_MAP  The basic right to search and route and so on.
TRAFFIC 
SPEEDCAM 
FREE_TRAFFIC 
FLEET 
WF_TRAFFIC_INFO_TEST  Traffic info test right.
SCDB  Access to speedcam information from SCDB.
DISABLE_POI_LAYER

Definition at line 357 of file MapRights.h.

Referenced by operator~().

MapRights::MapRights (  const MC2String &  hexString  )  [explicit]
 

Construct the rights from a string containing a hexadecimal representation of a 64-bit integer.

The string is read from the beginning. Any leading "0[xX]" is ignored. After that as many hexadecimal digits as possible are read. If there is no digits present in the string the constructed MapRights object will hold no rights.

Parameters:
hexString The string to interpret.

MapRights::MapRights (  const bitset_type &  rights  )  [inline, explicit, private]
 

Constructs a MapRights object from an instance of the bitset_type.

Parameters:
rights The rights that will be set in the new object.

Definition at line 371 of file MapRights.h.

MapRights & MapRights::filterMapRights (   )  [inline]
 

Some types of rights should not be set on the same map.

This function clears those rights that are less important(?) than other present rights. Actually calls the global MapRights filterMapRights(const MapRights&) function.

Returns:
A reference to this MapRights object.

bool MapRights::load (  const Packet *  packet,
int &  pos
) 
 

Load this MapRights object from a Packet.

Any previous informatino in this object is lost.

Parameters:
packet The Packet to read from.
pos The Packet position to start reading at. Will be updated to point past the end of the MapRights representation.
Returns:
True.

const MapRights & MapRights::operator &= (  const MapRights &  right  )  [inline]
 

Operator &= enables masking of rights in this MapRights object by another set of rights.

This MapRights object will loose all rights except those set in the right MapRights object.

Parameters:
right The masking set of rights.
Returns:
A const reference to this.

Definition at line 383 of file MapRights.h.

References m_rights.

const MapRights MapRights::operator~ (   )  const [inline]
 

The operator ~ creates a MapRights object that has none of the rights of this MapRights object, but all of the rights not held by this MapRights object.

Note that some bits will be set in the returned MapRights object that have no corresponding right.

Returns:
A inverted MapRights objct.

Friends And Related Function Documentation

bool operator< (  const MapRights &  lhs,
const MapRights &  rhs
)  [friend]
 

Order two MapRights object.

This operator< function will form a complete weak ordering.

Parameters:
lhs The MapRights object to the left of '<'.
rhs The MapRights object to the right of '<'.
Returns:
True if the left hand MapRights object should be ordered before the right hand side MapRights object, false otherwise.

Prints a MapRights object to an ostream.
